text:
Could you combine these ideas?

If submissions = 100 than set expiry date = today?

Just noticed that if you replace a page with a staged page (publishing a replacement) that any links in the menu modules will NOT update to the new page. Seems like a bug to me, but want everyone to know...
Is there any variable to use for the country, language and device without using the smartcontent?
<@U8G91EPCL> Is the fix related to a bug with SVGs containing a large shadow that I reported recently?
Have not seen that issue. This is related to svg thumbnails not rendering at all in the file manager.

<@U8G91EPCL> When I upload an SVG image with a shape that has a shadow larger than 10px, the image size indicated in Files (or returned in Hubl) is always 78 x 60 px. But it’s actually bigger. If I change the shadow to less than 10px, there is no issue.
Do you mind messaging me an example file that breaks the functionality? I can start looking into it.
<@U8G91EPCL> I’ll do

Quick question: My client has a footer on Landing Pages with forms. footer has a bit of text, then 6 company logos. I have the individual logos as svg and png. Should I create a single module and slice it into 7 parts and add an image widget to six of them and a text widget? or is there a better way of aligning and spacing these 7 bits on a line?
use display: flex; align-items: center; on the parent.
if you want a simple css solution
:point_up_2:
Thanks <@U7V9DQ31P> - I've got to get flex into my head!
yeah man! once you go flex you can't go back!

Hello
<@UH8USUDNF> here!
I want to help everyone's HubSpot project!
<@U2PDTMH53> <@U8G91EPCL> has the fix gone out? I am seeing loads of broken links for svgs
So, <@U7V9DQ31P>, how would you add these six images to the module group? Just as six image widgets, and then for the module group .class set it to display: flex; align-items: center; ?
Yeah
If you want it to wrap on mobile also add flex-wrap: wrap;

ok <@U7V9DQ31P>, will do! Got another issue, if I can impose on you: positioning a image so that it overlaps part of a form. I'm thinking put the image in a module group below the form, then - somehow - position it to overlay the form with negative margins. Suggestions?

quick q: When including CSS files, do those variables carry over as well? For example, if  I create a `colors.css` and inside of there place all my vars for colors, can i think include this in `main.css` and reference those vars from the color.css?
I thought you could but in testing it looks like it cant
you need to import as well
import handles hubl include does not
so you need to do both or just use the import?
both if you want the css included as well
import only handles HubL
ah ok, thanks <@U7SL518D6>
